info.description:
Kubermatic API

This describes possible operations which can be made against the Kubermatic API.
info.title: Kubermatic API.
info.termsOfService: there are no TOS at this moment, use at your own risk we take no responsibility

get.description: Lists available VM sizes in an Azure region

get.summary: Lists projects that an authenticated user is a member of.

post.description: Note that this endpoint can be consumed by every authenticated user.

delete.summary: Deletes the project with the given ID.

get.summary: Lists clusters for the specified project.

post.summary: Creates a cluster for the given project.

get.description: Gets the cluster with the given name

get.summary: Gets the kubeconfig for the specified cluster.

get.description: The returned collection of keys is sorted by creation timestamp.
get.summary: Lists SSH Keys that belong to the given project.

post.summary: Adds the given SSH key to the specified project.

delete.summary: Removes the given SSH Key from the system.

get.description: Lists SSH keys from the user

delete.description: Deletes a SSH keys for the user

post.description: Creates a SSH keys for the user

get.description: Lists all versions which don't result in automatic updates

AWSCloudSpec.title: AWSCloudSpec specifies access data to Amazon Web Services.

AWSDatacenterSpec.title: AWSDatacenterSpec specifies a data center of Amazon Web Services.

ami.description: ami to use. Will be defaulted to a ami for your selected operating system and region. Only set this when you know what you do.

diskSize.description: size of the volume in gb. Only one volume will be created

AttachedVolume.description: AttachedVolume describes a volume attached to a node

devicePath.description: DevicePath represents the device path where the volume should be available

AuthInfo.title: AuthInfo contains information that describes identity information.  This is use to tell the kubernetes cluster who you are.

as.description:
Impersonate is the username to imperonate.  The name matches the flag.
+optional

as-groups.description:
ImpersonateGroups is the groups to imperonate.
+optional

as-user-extra.description:
ImpersonateUserExtra contains additional information for impersonated user.
+optional

client-certificate.description:
ClientCertificate is the path to a client cert file for TLS.
+optional

client-certificate-data.description:
ClientCertificateData contains PEM-encoded data from a client cert file for TLS. Overrides ClientCertificate
+optional

client-key.description:
ClientKey is the path to a client key file for TLS.
+optional

client-key-data.description:
ClientKeyData contains PEM-encoded data from a client key file for TLS. Overrides ClientKey
+optional

extensions.description:
Extensions holds additional information. This is useful for extenders so that reads and writes don't clobber unknown fields
+optional

password.description:
Password is the password for basic authentication to the kubernetes cluster.
+optional

token.description:
Token is the bearer token for authentication to the kubernetes cluster.
+optional

tokenFile.description:
TokenFile is a pointer to a file that contains a bearer token (as described above).  If both Token and TokenFile are present, Token takes precedence.
+optional

username.description:
Username is the username for basic authentication to the kubernetes cluster.
+optional

AuthProviderConfig.title: AuthProviderConfig holds the configuration for a specified auth provider.

AvailableMasterVersions.description: AvailableMasterVersions describes all possible update versions for a cluster

AzureCloudSpec.title: AzureCloudSpec specifies acceess credentials to Azure cloud.

AzureDatacenterSpec.title: AzureDatacenterSpec specifies a datacenter of Azure.

AzureNodeSpecV1.description: AzureNodeSpec describes settings for an Azure node

assignPublicIP.description: should the machine have a publicly accessible IP address

AzureSize.title: AzureSize is the object representing Azure VM sizes.

AzureSizeList.title: AzureSizeList represents an array of Azure VM sizes.

BringYourOwnCloudSpec.title: BringYourOwnCloudSpec specifies access data for a bring your own cluster.

BringYourOwnDatacenterSpec.title: BringYourOwnDatacenterSpec specifies a data center with bring-your-own nodes.

CauseType.description:
CauseType is a machine readable value providing more detail about what
occurred in a status response. An operation may have multiple causes for a
status (whether Failure or Success).

distUpgradeOnBoot.description: do a dist-upgrade on boot and reboot it required afterwards

CloudSpec.title: CloudSpec mutually stores access data to a cloud provider.

dc.description: DatacenterName where the users 'cloud' lives in.

creationTimestamp.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created.

deletionTimestamp.description: DeletionTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was deleted.

id.description: ID unique value that identifies the resource generated by the server

name.description: Name represents human readable name for the resource

ClusterAddress.title: ClusterAddress stores access and address information of a cluster.

ClusterHealth.title: ClusterHealth stores health information of a cluster and the timestamp of the last change.

ClusterListV1.description: ClusterList represents a list of clusters

ClusterNetworkingConfig.description:
ClusterNetworkingConfig specifies the different networking
parameters for a cluster.

ClusterPhase.title: ClusterPhase is the life cycle phase of a cluster.

ClusterReqBody.description: ClusterReqBody represents the body of a new cluster request

ClusterSpec.title: ClusterSpec specifies the data for a new cluster.

pause.description:
Pause tells that this cluster is currently not managed by the controller.
It indicates that the user needs to do some action to resolve the pause.

pauseReason.description: PauseReason is the reason why the cluster is no being managed.

ClusterStatus.title: ClusterStatus stores status information about a cluster.

ClusterV1.title: Cluster is the object representing a cluster.

annotations.description:
Annotations is an unstructured key value map stored with a resource that may be
set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not
queryable and should be preserved when modifying objects.
More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations
+optional

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#resources
+optional

clusterName.description:
The name of the cluster which the object belongs to.
This is used to distinguish resources with same name and namespace in different clusters.
This field is not set anywhere right now and apiserver is going to ignore it if set in create or update request.
+optional

deletionGracePeriodSeconds.description:
Number of seconds allowed for this object to gracefully terminate before
it will be removed from the system. Only set when deletionTimestamp is also set.
May only be shortened.
Read-only.
+optional

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
in this list can only be removed.
+optional
+patchStrategy=merge

generateName.description:
GenerateName is an optional prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique
name ONLY IF the Name field has not been provided.
If this field is used, the name returned to the client will be different
than the name passed. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix.
The provided value has the same validation rules as the Name field,
and may be truncated by the length of the suffix required to make the value
unique on the server.

If this field is specified and the generated name exists, the server will
NOT return a 409 - instead, it will either return 201 Created or 500 with Reason
ServerTimeout indicating a unique name could not be found in the time allotted, and the client
should retry (optionally after the time indicated in the Retry-After header).

Applied only if Name is not specified.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#idempotency
+optional

generation.description:
A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.
Populated by the system. Read-only.
+optional

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
(scope and select) objects. May match selectors of replication controllers
and services.
More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels
+optional

name.description:
Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources, although
some resources may allow a client to request the generation of an appropriate name
automatically. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration
definition.
Cannot be updated.
More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names
+optional

namespace.description:
Namespace defines the space within each name must be unique. An empty namespace is
equivalent to the "default" namespace, but "default" is the canonical representation.
Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for
those objects will be empty.

Must be a DNS_LABEL.
Cannot be updated.
More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/namespaces
+optional

ownerReferences.description:
List of objects depended by this object. If ALL objects in the list have
been deleted, this object will be garbage collected. If this object is managed by a controller,
then an entry in this list will point to this controller, with the controller field set to true.
There cannot be more than one managing controller.
+optional
+patchMergeKey=uid
+patchStrategy=merge

resourceVersion.description:
An opaque value that represents the internal version of this object that can
be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. May be used for optimistic
concurrency, change detection, and the watch operation on a resource or set of resources.
Clients must treat these values as opaque and passed unmodified back to the server.
They may only be valid for a particular resource or set of resources.

Populated by the system.
Read-only.
Value must be treated as opaque by clients and .
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
+optional

selfLink.description:
SelfLink is a URL representing this object.
Populated by the system.
Read-only.
+optional

names.description:
Names by which this image is known.
e.g. ["k8s.gcr.io/hyperkube:v1.0.7", "dockerhub.io/google_containers/hyperkube:v1.0.7"]

sizeBytes.description:
The size of the image in bytes.
+optional

Context.description: Context is a tuple of references to a cluster (how do I communicate with a kubernetes cluster), a user (how do I identify myself), and a namespace (what subset of resources do I want to work with)

cluster.description: Cluster is the name of the cluster for this context

extensions.description:
Extensions holds additional information. This is useful for extenders so that reads and writes don't clobber unknown fields
+optional

namespace.description:
Namespace is the default namespace to use on unspecified requests
+optional

user.description: AuthInfo is the name of the authInfo for this context

CreateClusterReqBody.description: CreateClusterReqBody represents the request body for a create cluster request

CreateNodeReqBodyV3.description: CreateNodeReqBodyV3 represents the request body of a create nodes request

CreateNodesReqBody.description: CreateNodesReqBody represents the request body of a create nodes request

DaemonEndpoint.title: DaemonEndpoint contains information about a single Daemon endpoint.

Port.description: Port number of the given endpoint.

Datacenter.title: Datacenter is the object representing a Kubernetes infra datacenter.

DatacenterList.description: DatacenterList represents a list of datacenters

DatacenterSpec.title: DatacenterSpec specifies the data for a datacenter.

DigitaloceanCloudSpec.title: DigitaloceanCloudSpec specifies access data to DigitalOcean.

DigitaloceanSize.title: DigitaloceanSize is the object representing digitalocean sizes.

DigitaloceanSizeList.title: DigitaloceanSizeList represents a object of digitalocean sizes.

DigitialoceanDatacenterSpec.title: DigitialoceanDatacenterSpec specifies a datacenter of DigitalOcean.

ErrorDetails.description: ErrorDetails contains details about the error

ExecConfig.description:
See the client.authentiction.k8s.io API group for specifications of the exact input
and output format
ExecConfig.title:
ExecConfig specifies a command to provide client credentials. The command is exec'd
and outputs structured stdout holding credentials.

apiVersion.description:
Preferred input version of the ExecInfo. The returned ExecCredentials MUST use
the same encoding version as the input.

args.description:
Arguments to pass to the command when executing it.
+optional

env.description:
Env defines additional environment variables to expose to the process. These
are unioned with the host's environment, as well as variables client-go uses
to pass argument to the plugin.
+optional

ExecEnvVar.description:
ExecEnvVar is used for setting environment variables when executing an exec-based
credential plugin.

FakeCloudSpec.title: FakeCloudSpec specifies access data for a fake cloud.

HetznerCloudSpec.title: HetznerCloudSpec specifies access data to hetzner cloud.

HetznerDatacenterSpec.title: HetznerDatacenterSpec specifies a datacenter of Hetzner.

ImageList.description: ImageList defines a map of operating system and the image to use

Initializer.title: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.

name.description: name of the process that is responsible for initializing this object.

Initializers.title: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization.

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is visible.
When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
clients.
+patchMergeKey=name
+patchStrategy=merge

KeyCert.title: KeyCert is a pair of key and cert.

apiVersion.description:
Legacy field from pkg/api/types.go TypeMeta.
TODO(jlowdermilk): remove this after eliminating downstream dependencies.
+optional

clusters.description: Clusters is a map of referencable names to cluster configs

contexts.description: Contexts is a map of referencable names to context configs

current-context.description: CurrentContext is the name of the context that you would like to use by default

extensions.description:
Extensions holds additional information. This is useful for extenders so that reads and writes don't clobber unknown fields
+optional

kind.description:
Legacy field from pkg/api/types.go TypeMeta.
TODO(jlowdermilk): remove this after eliminating downstream dependencies.
+optional

users.description: AuthInfos is a map of referencable names to user configs

MasterVersion.description: MasterVersion describes a version of the master components

NamedAuthInfo.description: NamedAuthInfo relates nicknames to auth information

name.description: Name is the nickname for this AuthInfo

NamedCluster.description: NamedCluster relates nicknames to cluster information

name.description: Name is the nickname for this Cluster

NamedContext.description: NamedContext relates nicknames to context information

name.description: Name is the nickname for this Context

NamedExtension.description: NamedExtension relates nicknames to extension information

name.description: Name is the nickname for this Extension

NetworkRanges.title: NetworkRanges represents ranges of network addresses.

version.description: Version desired version of the kubernetes master components

url.description: URL specifies the address at which the cluster is available

version.description: Version actual version of the kubernetes master components

NewObjectMeta.description: NewObjectMeta defines the set of fields that all object returned from the API must have

creationTimestamp.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created.

deletionTimestamp.description: DeletionTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was deleted.

id.description: ID unique value that identifies the resource generated by the server

name.description: Name represents human readable name for the resource

NewSSHKeyList.description: NewSSHKeyList represents a list of NewSSHKey

NewSSHKeySpec.description: NewSSHKeySpec represents the details of a ssh key

NodeAddress.title: NodeAddress contains information for the node's address.

NodeAddressV2.title: NodeAddress contains information for the node's address.

NodeCloudSpecV2.title: NodeCloudSpec represents the collection of cloud provider specific settings. Only one must be set at a time.

NodeCondition.title: NodeCondition contains condition information for a node.

message.description:
Human readable message indicating details about last transition.
+optional

reason.description:
(brief) reason for the condition's last transition.
+optional

NodeConfigSource.title: NodeConfigSource specifies a source of node configuration. Exactly one subfield (excluding metadata) must be non-nil.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#resources
+optional

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

NodeContainerRuntimeInfoV2.description: NodeContainerRuntimeInfo information about the container runtime. Currently only "cri-o" and "docker" are supported

NodeDaemonEndpoints.title: NodeDaemonEndpoints lists ports opened by daemons running on the Node.

NodeListV1.description: NodeList represents a list of nodes

NodeListV2.description: NodeList represents a list of nodes

NodeResourcesV2.description: NodeResources cpu and memory of a node

NodeSpec.title: NodeSpec describes the attributes that a node is created with.

externalID.description:
External ID of the node assigned by some machine database (e.g. a cloud provider).
Deprecated.
+optional

podCIDR.description:
PodCIDR represents the pod IP range assigned to the node.
+optional

providerID.description:
ID of the node assigned by the cloud provider in the format: <ProviderName>://<ProviderSpecificNodeID>
+optional

unschedulable.description:
Unschedulable controls node schedulability of new pods. By default, node is schedulable.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#manual-node-administration
+optional

NodeStatus.title: NodeStatus is information about the current status of a node.

addresses.description:
List of addresses reachable to the node.
Queried from cloud provider, if available.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#addresses
+optional
+patchMergeKey=type
+patchStrategy=merge

conditions.description:
Conditions is an array of current observed node conditions.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/nodes/node/#condition
+optional
+patchMergeKey=type
+patchStrategy=merge

images.description:
List of container images on this node
+optional

volumesAttached.description:
List of volumes that are attached to the node.
+optional

volumesInUse.description:
List of attachable volumes in use (mounted) by the node.
+optional

NodeStatusV2.title: NodeStatus is information about the current status of a node.

errorMessage.description: in case of a error this will contain a detailed error explanation

errorReason.description: in case of a error this will contain a short error message

machineName.description: name of the actual Machine object

NodeSystemInfo.title: NodeSystemInfo is a set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node.

architecture.description: The Architecture reported by the node

bootID.description: Boot ID reported by the node.

containerRuntimeVersion.description: ContainerRuntime Version reported by the node through runtime remote API (e.g. docker://1.5.0).

kernelVersion.description: Kernel Version reported by the node from 'uname -r' (e.g. 3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64).

kubeProxyVersion.description: KubeProxy Version reported by the node.

kubeletVersion.description: Kubelet Version reported by the node.

machineID.description:
MachineID reported by the node. For unique machine identification
in the cluster this field is preferred. Learn more from man(5)
machine-id: http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/machine-id.5.html

operatingSystem.description: The Operating System reported by the node

osImage.description: OS Image reported by the node from /etc/os-release (e.g. Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy)).

systemUUID.description:
SystemUUID reported by the node. For unique machine identification
MachineID is preferred. This field is specific to Red Hat hosts
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Subscription_Management/1/html/RHSM/getting-system-uuid.html

NodeSystemInfoV2.title: NodeSystemInfo is a set of versions/ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node.

NodeV1.title: Node is the object representing a cluster node.

NodeV2.title: Node is the object representing a cluster node.

ObjectMeta.title: ObjectMeta is an object storing common metadata for persistable objects.

ObjectMetaV2.title: ObjectMeta is an object storing common metadata for persistable objects.

creationTimestamp.description: CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was created.

deletionTimestamp.description: DeletionTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was deleted.

displayName.description: The name to display in the frontend

ObjectReference.title: ObjectReference contains enough information to let you inspect or modify the referred object.

fieldPath.description:
If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string
should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2].
For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like:
"spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered
the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with
index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of
referencing a part of an object.
TODO: this design is not final and this field is subject to change in the future.
+optional

kind.description:
Kind of the referent.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

name.description:
Name of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names
+optional

namespace.description:
Namespace of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/
+optional

resourceVersion.description:
Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
+optional

OpenstackCloudSpec.title: OpenstackCloudSpec specifies access data to an openstack cloud.

OpenstackDatacenterSpec.title: OpenstackDatacenterSpec specifies a generic bare metal datacenter.

OpenstackSize.title: OpenstackSize is the object representing openstack's sizes.

disk.description: Disk is the amount of root disk, measured in GB

isPublic.description: IsPublic indicates whether the size is public (available to all projects) or scoped to a set of projects

memory.description: Memory is the amount of memory, measured in MB

region.description: Region specifies the geographic region in which the size resides

slug.description: Slug holds  the name of the size

swap.description: Swap is the amount of swap space, measured in MB

vcpus.description: VCPUs indicates how many (virtual) CPUs are available for this flavor

OpenstackTenant.title: OpenstackTenant is the object representing a openstack tenant.

id.description: Id uniquely identifies the current tenant

name.description: Name is the name of the tenant

OpenstackTenantList.description: OpenstackTenantList represents a list of OpenstackTenants

OperatingSystemSpecV2.title: OperatingSystemSpec represents the collection of os specific settings. Only one must be set at a time.

OwnerReference.description:
OwnerReference contains enough information to let you identify an owning
object. Currently, an owning object must be in the same namespace, so there
is no namespace field.

blockOwnerDeletion.description:
If true, AND if the owner has the "foregroundDeletion" finalizer, then
the owner cannot be deleted from the key-value store until this
reference is removed.
Defaults to false.
To set this field, a user needs "delete" permission of the owner,
otherwise 422 (Unprocessable Entity) will be returned.
+optional

controller.description:
If true, this reference points to the managing controller.
+optional

kind.description:
Kind of the referent.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description:
Name of the referent.
More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

extensions.description:
Extensions holds additional information. This is useful for extenders so that reads and writes don't clobber unknown fields
+optional

Project.description: Project is a top-level container for a set of resources

RSAKeys.title: RSAKeys is a pair of private and public key where the key is not published to the API client.

RawExtension.title: RawExtension is used to hold extensions in external versions.

Raw.description:
Raw is the underlying serialization of this object.

TODO: Determine how to detect ContentType and ContentEncoding of 'Raw' data.

ResourceList.title: ResourceList is a set of (resource name, quantity) pairs.

SSHKeySpec.description: SSHKeySpec represents the details of a ssh key

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#resources
+optional

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.
+optional

continue.description:
continue may be set if the user set a limit on the number of items returned, and indicates that
the server has more data available. The value is opaque and may be used to issue another request
to the endpoint that served this list to retrieve the next set of available objects. Continuing a
list may not be possible if the server configuration has changed or more than a few minutes have
passed. The resourceVersion field returned when using this continue value will be identical to
the value in the first response.

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

message.description:
A human-readable description of the status of this operation.
+optional

resourceVersion.description:
String that identifies the server's internal version of this object that
can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed.
Value must be treated as opaque by clients and passed unmodified back to the server.
Populated by the system.
Read-only.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency
+optional

selfLink.description:
selfLink is a URL representing this object.
Populated by the system.
Read-only.
+optional

status.description:
Status of the operation.
One of: "Success" or "Failure".
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status
+optional

StatusCause.description:
StatusCause provides more information about an api.Status failure, including
cases when multiple errors are encountered.

field.description:
The field of the resource that has caused this error, as named by its JSON
serialization. May include dot and postfix notation for nested attributes.
Arrays are zero-indexed.  Fields may appear more than once in an array of
causes due to fields having multiple errors.
Optional.

Examples:
"name" - the field "name" on the current resource
"items[0].name" - the field "name" on the first array entry in "items"
+optional

message.description:
A human-readable description of the cause of the error.  This field may be
presented as-is to a reader.
+optional

StatusDetails.description:
StatusDetails is a set of additional properties that MAY be set by the
server to provide additional information about a response. The Reason
field of a Status object defines what attributes will be set. Clients
must ignore fields that do not match the defined type of each attribute,
and should assume that any attribute may be empty, invalid, or under
defined.

causes.description:
The Causes array includes more details associated with the StatusReason
failure. Not all StatusReasons may provide detailed causes.
+optional

group.description:
The group attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason.
+optional

kind.description:
The kind attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason.
On some operations may differ from the requested resource Kind.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds
+optional

name.description:
The name attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason
(when there is a single name which can be described).
+optional

retryAfterSeconds.description:
If specified, the time in seconds before the operation should be retried. Some errors may indicate
the client must take an alternate action - for those errors this field may indicate how long to wait
before taking the alternate action.
+optional

StatusReason.description:
StatusReason is an enumeration of possible failure causes.  Each StatusReason
must map to a single HTTP status code, but multiple reasons may map
to the same HTTP status code.
TODO: move to apiserver

Taint.description:
The node this Taint is attached to has the "effect" on
any pod that does not tolerate the Taint.

key.description: Required. The taint key to be applied to a node.

value.description:
Required. The taint value corresponding to the taint key.
+optional

Time.title:
Time is a wrapper around time.Time which supports correct
marshaling to YAML and JSON.  Wrappers are provided for many
of the factory methods that the time package offers.

UID.description:
UID is a type that holds unique ID values, including UUIDs.  Because we
don't ONLY use UUIDs, this is an alias to string.  Being a type captures
intent and helps make sure that UIDs and names do not get conflated.

distUpgradeOnBoot.description: do a dist-upgrade on boot and reboot it required afterwards

User.title: User represents an API user that is used for authentication.

VSphereCloudSpec.title: VSphereCloudSpec specifies access data to VSphere cloud.

VSphereDatacenterSpec.title: VSphereDatacenterSpec specifies a datacenter of VSphere.

Version.title: Version represents a single semantic version.

errorResponse.description: ErrorResponse is the default representation of an error
